nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.simulators

Class DEVSAnimator<A extends java.lang.Comparable<A>,R extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<R>,T extends SimTime<A,R,T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.simulation.event.EventProducer
      • nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.simulators.Simulator<A,R,T>
        • nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.simulators.DEVSSimulator<A,R,T>
          • nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.simulators.DEVSAnimator<A,R,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - the absolute storage type for the simulation time, e.g. Calendar, Duration, or Double.
    R - the relative type for time storage, e.g. Long for the Calendar. For most non-calendar types, the absolute and relative types are the same.
    T - the extended type itself to be able to implement a comparator on the simulation time.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.rmi.Remote, AnimatorInterface, DEVSSimulatorInterface<A,R,T>, SimulatorInterface<A,R,T>, nl.tudelft.simulation.event.EventProducerInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DEVSAnimator.CalendarDouble, DEVSAnimator.CalendarFloat, DEVSAnimator.CalendarLong, DEVSAnimator.TimeDouble, DEVSAnimator.TimeDoubleUnit, DEVSAnimator.TimeFloat, DEVSAnimator.TimeFloatUnit, DEVSAnimator.TimeLong, DEVSRealTimeClock

    public class DEVSAnimator<A extends java.lang.Comparable<A>,R extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<R>,T extends SimTime<A,R,T>>
extends DEVSSimulator<A,R,T>
implements AnimatorInterface
    The reference implementation of the animator.

    (c) 2002-2018 Delft University of Technology , the Netherlands.
    See for project information www.simulation.tudelft.nl

      • run

        public void run()
        The run method defines the actual time step mechanism of the simulator. The implementation of this method depends on the formalism. Where discrete event formalisms loop over an eventlist continuous simulators take pre-defined time steps.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class DEVSSimulator<A extends java.lang.Comparable<A>,R extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<R>,T extends SimTime<A,R,T>>
